title: Regulatory bump at ECA as float runway shortens, PE circles
text:
It's no secret that if an initial public offering contender harbours plans to list this year, it should already be well advanced in its preparations.

And while international student specialist Education Centres of Australia has been readying for months, it seems to have hit a few hurdles at the wrong time.

There's extra time being spent to get the numbers right - as we reported last week - and now there is a regulatory issue at ECA-owned ECA Graduate Institute Pty Ltd.

The timing of Education Centres of Australia's sharemarket float is up in the air. Louie Douvis

ECA Graduate Institute had its licence cancelled by the Australian Skills Quality Authority on September 25.

While ECA Graduate Institute is said to account for less than 5 per cent of group revenue and the company can shuffle its student clients around, it's not the sort of news potential investors would want to read about in a prospectus.
description: It's no secret that if an initial public offering contender harbours plans to list this year, it should already be well advanced in its preparations.
